title: Pronouns
description: This deprecated pattern was designed to ask Veterans for their pronouns in order to address them appropriately.

frontMatter.title: Pronouns
frontMatter.description: This deprecated pattern was designed to ask Veterans for their pronouns in order to address them appropriately.
frontMatter.intro: This pattern was designed to ask Veterans for their pronouns in order to address them appropriately. The current policy recommends against using this pattern.

when_to_use.value: **Appropriate addressing.** When you need to collect a person's pronouns in order to address them appropriately.
**User comfort.** Allowing users to choose their pronouns creates a more comfortable interaction.

design_principles.value: **Multiple selection.** Use checkboxes so that Veterans can identify with multiple descriptions.
**Opt-out option.** Provide checkbox labeled 'Use my preferred name'.
**Custom entry.** Allow for users to provide their own answer with an open-ended text field.

when_not_to_use.value: **Policy recommendation.** The current policy recommends against using this pattern.

examples.title: Pronoun selection
examples.description: Checkboxes allowing Veterans to select multiple pronoun options.

examples.title: Custom pronoun entry
examples.description: Text field for users to provide their own pronoun.

how_to_build.intro: This pattern is deprecated. Contact the Design System Council for current guidance.

steps.value: This pattern is deprecated and should not be used in new implementations.
For existing implementations, contact the Design System Council for migration guidance.

accessibility.value: Use a single text field to capture options not found in a list to maintain screen reader accessibility.
Avoid progressive disclosure interactions that may confuse assistive technology users.
